result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Taylor J Wargin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Taylor J Wargin in court.  
Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court for Taylor J Wargin.  
Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense  request a dpa hearing date. 
Defense advised to file the plea documents 24 hours in advance of the hearing,. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 9:00am
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.

Defendant Taylor J Wargin in court in person.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski appeared by video for Taylor J Wargin.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer L. Rivera. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Taylor J Wargin in court in person. Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report

Court ordered no contact with Adult Female Victim LMW 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Taylor J Wargin in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Taylor J Wargin in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Taylor J Wargin appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
